title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Control Algorithm Design and Simulation Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented design for real-world application, conducted in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.

learning_goals: Describes the control algorithm design process combining Q-learning and ART-based adaptive resonance methods
Implements a reinforcement learning model for solving inverted pendulum control problems using simulation tools

Learners measure inference speed, memory usage, and power consumption of a given neural network model (e.g., ResNet-50), propose at least three optimization methods (e.g., quantization, pruning, parallel computation) using profiling tools (e.g., TensorBoard, PyTorch Profiler), and demonstrate performance improvements (20% faster inference or 15% reduced memory usage).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
